xxl.core.pipes.sources
Class AbstractSource<O>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource<O>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Source<O>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractTimeStampSource, CursorSource, Enumerator, HighwaySource, NEXMarkGeneratorSource, Permutator, RandomNumber
public abstract class AbstractSource<O>
extends AbstractNode
implements Source<O>

Superclass for each kind of initial sources in a query graph. Abstract implementation of the interface Source.
Simulates an active data source by starting a new thread, i.e. an instance of the class SourceProcessor, which periodically transfers elements to all subscribed sinks.
The next element of this source is accessed via the abstract next method, which has to be overwritten by a concrete source inheriting from this abstract class.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
SourceProcessor

Constructor Detail

AbstractSource

public AbstractSource(SourceProcessor processor)
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph.

Parameters:
processor - The thread simulating this source's activity.

AbstractSource

public AbstractSource(long period)
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph. Creates a new instance of the class SourceProcessor using the given period.

Parameters:
period - The constant period of time between two transferred successive elements.

AbstractSource

public AbstractSource()
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph. Transfers the source's elements as fast as possible, i.e., the attribute period of a SourceProcessor is set to 0. The output rate is not measured.

startProcessor

protected void startProcessor()
Starts the associated processor.

open

public void open()
          throws SourceIsClosedException
Opens this source and starts the thread simulating the source's activity.
Sets the flag isOpenend.

Specified by:
open in interface Source<O>
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

close

public void close()
If a source is closed, all subscribed sinks are unsubscribed.
Sets the flag isClosed and clears the flag isOpened.

Specified by:
close in interface Source<O>

transfer

public void transfer(O o)
Transfers the given element to all subscribed sinks. The process method is invoked for each of these sinks with the element to be transferred and the ID the corresponding sink initially specified during its subscription.
Additionally, this method measures the outputRate if measureOutputRate is set.

Specified by:
transfer in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.

subscribe

public boolean subscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                         int sinkID)
                  throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
Subscribes the specified sink with the given ID to this source. The ID is necessary to distinguish different sources when using operators based on multiple inputs.
The sink and its corresponding ID have to be stored in an internal datastructure by this source and each sink can be accessed by an index.

Specified by:
subscribe in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink to be subscribed.
sinkID - The ID which will be passed when transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the subscribe operation has been successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

unsubscribe

public boolean unsubscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                           int sinkID)
                    throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
The given sink cancels its subscription. The registered sink with the given ID will not be informed about new elements any longer. If a sink is subscribed plurally, i.e. the same sink is subscribed with different IDs, only the subscription concerning the specified ID will be removed.

Specified by:
unsubscribe in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
sinkID - The ID of the sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
Returns:
Returns true, if the unsubscribe operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

getSink

public Sink<? super O> getSink(int index)
                        throws SourceIsClosedException,
                               IllegalArgumentException,
                               IndexOutOfBoundsException
Description copied from interface: Source
Returns a reference to a Sink belonging to the specified index. A sink was associated with this index when it called the subscribe method.

Specified by:
getSink in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
index - The index used to access subscribed sinks within this source.
Returns:
The sink belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sinks have been subscribed.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

getSinkID

public int getSinkID(Sink<? super O> sink)
              throws SourceIsClosedException,
                     IllegalArgumentException
Returns the ID of the sink, which has initially been specified when the given sink was subscribed to this source.
A linear pass through the interal sink array is performed to determine the position of the first matching sink. This position is used to access the internal ID array, because during a subscription both arrays are updated at the same position.

Specified by:
getSinkID in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription ID should be detected.
Returns:
The first matching ID of the specified sink.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sink is not subscribed.

getNoOfSinks

public int getNoOfSinks()
                 throws SourceIsClosedException
Returns the number of sinks that are currently subscribed to this source.
The length of the internal sink array is returned.

Specified by:
getNoOfSinks in interface Source<O>
Returns:
The number of sinks.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

next

public abstract O next()
                throws NoSuchElementException
Abstract method that is called by the thread simulating the activity of this source with the intention to retrieve the next element. If this data source has no further elements that can be transferred, the method should throw a new NoSuchElementException.

Returns:
The next element to be emitted by this source.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - If this source has no further elements.
